title: Ticket #4914: Unable to use 127.0.0.1:0 as COLLECTOR_HOST on Windows.
description:
Starting HTCondor on Windows with a COLLECTOR_HOST of 127.0.0.1:0 causes the collector to always try to bind to port 9618; the master fails to realize that 127.0.0.1 is itself, and so it can't find itself in the the COLLECTOR_HOST list to determine what the collector's port number should otherwise be.

8.3 has an explicit check to see if the collector's address is loopback. I'm not sure why this wasn't back-ported.

This would be useful for testing on laptops, in particular.
